Imperativ.turoyo: mžad; možád; ožád; 665; mžad raġlux LB 50;mžad ruḥux LB 66;

Part. Pass..turoyo: mžido; mžītto; 666; ga kale zlām mžido tamo w-ʕayne ftiḥeaṯi u=zʕuro u=garwono zbəṭle u=məšḥo w-kfəxle b-feme d-Kayalo w-hiye damixo l=ule w-lo=šqile našəf b-dukṯe (…) nafiqo i=žənəke ko-ḥayro Kayalo kale mžido qayiso našifo
translations: ‘There lies a man with open eyes’; 46/30;

‘The bald boy came, grabbed the (boiling) butter and poured it in Kayalo’s mouth, while he was sleeping. He did not move, he stiffened where he sat (…). The woman came out and saw that Kayalo was stretched and completely frozen’ 76/153-155;
